summary: PHP SDK workers cannot be configured to listen to a specific namespace, only to the default namespace. This prevents workers from processing tasks in non-default namespaces when clients are created with different namespace options.
userImpact: Users cannot configure workers to listen to non-default namespaces, breaking multi-namespace deployments and requiring manual .rr.yaml configuration workarounds.
rootCause: PHP SDK WorkerOptions lacks namespace configuration support that exists in other SDKs like Go, requiring manual RoadRunner configuration instead.
proposedFix: Add namespace support to WorkerOptions similar to WorkflowClient, allowing workers to be configured with a specific namespace during creation.
workaround: Manually edit the .rr.yaml RoadRunner configuration file to set the namespace for workers.
resolutionDetails: Namespace support was included in v2.6.1 RoadRunner release, providing the necessary configuration capability in the generated .rr.yaml file.
keyQuote: Creating a worker only listens to the `default` namespace. How can we avoid that?
